problems.title: Minimum Size Subarray Sum (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
Given an array of positive integers nums and a positive integer target, return the minimal length of a subarray whose sum is greater than or equal to target. If there is no such subarray, return 0 instead.

Input Format:
First line: two integers n and target.
Second line: n space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Print a single integer: the minimal length.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
6 7
2 3 1 2 4 3

Sample Output
2

Explanation: The subarray [4,3] has the minimal length under the problem constraint.
hintsList: Think about how to use a sliding window to optimize the solution.
Consider using a frequency map or two pointers to track the window state.
